name: CN Tower
description: Iconic 553.3m-high tower with panoramic views, revolving restaurant, and glass floor observation deck

name: Casa Loma
description: Gothic Revival style mansion and garden built in the early 20th century, now a museum and landmark

name: Royal Ontario Museum
description: Museum of art, world culture and natural history, featuring diverse collections and exhibits

name: Art Gallery of Ontario
description: Major art museum with a collection of more than 90,000 works spanning from 100 AD to present

name: Distillery District
description: Historic and entertainment precinct with Victorian architecture, shops, restaurants, and galleries

name: St. Lawrence Market
description: Historic market complex featuring food vendors, restaurants, and artisanal products

name: Toronto Zoo
description: Large zoo with over 5,000 animals from around the world, including pandas and polar bears

name: Ripley's Aquarium of Canada
description: Modern aquarium featuring 16,000 aquatic animals and interactive exhibits

name: High Park
description: Large urban park with diverse vegetation, recreational facilities, and a small zoo

name: Hockey Hall of Fame
description: Museum dedicated to the history of ice hockey, featuring exhibits and memorabilia
